meanings.sent1: She repatched her torn dress with a needle and thread.
meanings.sent2: The handyman repatched the leaky roof to stop the water from coming in.
meanings.sent3: After the dog chewed on it, she repatched the chew toy to make it whole again.
meanings.sent4: He repatched his broken heart with love and kindness.
meanings.sent5: The old quilt was repatched with colorful fabric, making it look good as new.

meanings.definition: To repair or fix by patching again.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic repatched the tire to stop it from going flat.
meanings.sent2: She repatched the hole in the wall with some plaster and paint.
meanings.sent3: He repatched the torn page in the book, making it whole once more.
meanings.sent4: They repatched their friendship after a misunderstanding.
meanings.sent5: The tailor repatched the torn seam on the dress, making it look seamless.
